intro: Schuurmansia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved Schuurmansia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces small, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Schuurmansia parvifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers.
